>>246168897
I kinda liked it.

A girl denied of all human contact has only books as a source of knowledge or "truth". From the beginning she feels odd, disconnected from everything, almost like nothing fazed her. She couldn't fully empathize with the feelings of the room occupants, as they were people that chose to live their escpasim, running away from the truth.
The "desire" rot, a disease that corrupts you if you decide to leave didn't affect her. Because unlike the occupants she hungered for the truth, that she thought she'd find outside the book.

Alice had always felt incomplete, seeing human bonds and experiences only through the lens of the books. She wanted to consume all the knowledge in the world to complete her. But when she was finished she found it was a pity that there was no one left she could form bonds or experiences of her own with. Even with all the knowledge of the world, she was still alone.
